title: No-Code for Citizen Developers
description: The number of people who want to create applications on Cardano far outpaces the number of individuals with the required technical expertise

f6_assessments.q0:
This is an interesting approach to the challenge: "How can we encourage entrepreneurs from outside the Cardano ecosystem to submit proposals to Catalyst in the next two funds?"

Unfortunately this feels like an attempt to get Project Catalyst to pay for the company's sales efforts (due to the $30 per month charge after the free month).
f6_assessments.q1:
700 proposals from co-working spaces is an ambitious goal. However, snail-mailing, emailing and cold calling 30,000 random co-working spaces doesn't sound like a very efficient approach. Who would you call in the workspaces? And would it really be one or two person's job to approach all 30,000 of them? Just out of curiosity, what CRM system are you using? It better have a great soft phone integration and a fast way to record the outcome of the call. How much time would be used for documenting the outcome of the calls?

Also, the proposal does not consider the fact that due to COVID many co-working spaces had to close their doors.

Should the proposer come up with a better approach to engage the co-working spaces, we could think of a concentrated effort to build local Cardano hubs into these spaces and make this a much more decentralized proposal with many parties involved.
f6_assessments.q2:
The goals and the plan seem unrealistic.

Note to voters:
This team was funded with $20,000 in Fund5 and has now proposed five interesting challenges in Fund6 totaling $200,000+ USD:
https://www.cardanonocode.com/projects.html
https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/No-Code-For-Creative-Africa/351502-48088

Equipping the proposals with videos is a really good way to deliver the message (although one of the videos could use some editing). The proposals would have been better if they had been proofread, however.

My ability to evaluate the proposals:
In my day job I use no-code development approach every day but I haven't used Q-Modeler before. It sounds fantastic but unfortunately I cannot judge the proposal with 100% technical accuracy due to my lack of experience with the technology.

As a CA I have high integrity and I never copy-paste my assessments. This proposer, rightfully so, has copy-pasted so much that I follow suit. Also, it took hours to go through all proposals, related videos and websites.
f6_assessments.reply: No creteria given to back up the claims of the project being unrealistic. The following quote seems like non objective criteria and perhaps not  the most professional  comment: "Unfortunately this feels like an attempt to get Project Catalyst to pay for the company's sales efforts (due to the $30 per month charge after the free month)."  This reviewer needs needs coaching.  No justifications given for the for any of the statements or voting

f6_assessments.q0:
The idea would allow for overcoming obstacles associated wit coding, for people outside dev world (very positive value proposition). No doubt cryptocurrency world needs to be simpler. the problem is really clear and the proposal addresses it, in line with the campaign challenge (in this case, it would expand the presence of citzen developers in Cardano network).

However, I would not limit it co-work spaces. It would be interesting to also reach education centrers (like universitites, collegres, courses) and even companies who could use blockchain programs in tis regular business.
Theres also an additional barrier to coding itself which is the knowledger about blockchain, smart contract and Cardano. Many people around the world dont know its full capacity or dont even know it exists. In order to overcome this, it would be useful not only to "hide" the coding part of the application but also to clearly and simply explain/train people in blockchain and smart contracts and how its potential applications could be used in their daily lives/works.
 It would also be useful to have the Qmodeler in some different languages, to reach even more people. Built-in tutorials (about the program and blockchain/smar contracts) as well as templates for some basic general applications  could also be available.
Last, it could be better explored here how this product differeniate from other no code blockchain application or at least how this is going to be levaraged during the marketing/selling part of the project (which is the main part). Why would I cowork space buy Qmodeler and not some other similar product?
f6_assessments.q1:
The company (Ferdon) seems to be robust to create a good program like Qmodeler and promote it well at least for events. However, it could be clearer in the proposal the capabilities of the people they will allocate in this project, as its more related to marketing and commercial than to technical aspects of the program. also, not clear here if they would need to hire extra people or just reallocate the ones they have internally to his project
Do they have any experience/competencies with online marketing to create email campaigns? how is their experience in selling this products, will they know how to convince coworks spaces that this product is better than others?

Regading the plan, it seems well detailed, sensible and budget is well divided in the project phases/activities.
f6_assessments.q2:
the metrics here is good and detailed enough. It's good to see it divided into 2 parts: the project and the outreach, which makes it easier to see how it will  help the "proposer outreach F6 campaign"

to make it even more transparent, I'd breakdown some of the proposed KPIs in number of different countries reached (for instance, number of signed ups cowork spaces in country X, Y,  etc.). Roadmap and milestones are also good.

One thing that Id add up here is some challenges and risks involving low knowledge of blockchain/smart contracts, non english speakers and product differentiation.

f6_assessments.q0: This is an excellent project to lower the bar to accessibility for entrepreneurs, by creating a no-code platform that allows entrepreneurs to create their own app without having to have high technical expertise. They even have a sliding scale payment plan based on cost of living to allow individuals living in areas such as Africa to pay less monthly, making it quite egalitarian.
f6_assessments.q1: There isn't much detail available online about the team. I even scoured linkedin, and the employees are not listed. The level of detail to their website and proposals suggests that they have the expertise to execute on their idea and have been at work at this for some time.
f6_assessments.q2: They set out KPIs for 3, 6, and 9 months, mostly focused on building sales/partnership leads, rather than on promising MVP aspects of the product, per se. That aspect of developing the business seems as vital as the tech, so it's reassuring to see that being focused on. It would be nice to see some KPIs laid out for the tech, though, as well.

f6_assessments.q0:
I agree that providing a platform for no-coders to create a coded outcome, can definitely increase the production of the community. On the other hand, I am not sure how much it is aligned with proposer outreach.

1. you have someone with a good idea, he does not need to code, he can hire someone to code
2. you have not a good idea, and you can not code (but you have a platform for no-coder) - it will not automatically increase the number of proposers
3. this solution will increase the number of people involved in the process, but I do not see a direct influence on the number of proposers. Right now, you can propose even if you have 0 skills and 0 knowledge, any idea is accepted and assessed.
f6_assessments.q1: I think sending emails, making calls, and creating a database is not so "hard" rather time-consuming task, so I have faith in this matter.

the proposal can be easily reviewed and audited if required. 
number of emails sent
number of connections made in the database
increase/decrease of members

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal seeks to address some key aspect of this problem that is give opportunity to bright entrepreneurs with little knowledge about coding or technology who are outside the cardano ecosystem through its platforms and hackathons.  However, it's target focus should be broadened to reach out to every bright idea being creating of software to business ideas that will bring changes across the globe.
f6_assessments.q1: This team has being a part of the cardano ecosystem for sometime and are aware of the vision and mission. They have the skill and have provided us with prove of their experience via videos and links. Think its and ongoing work which just needs some push to be fully implemented. Their website has been provided where detail knowledge about the company, the location and the team is there to access and also their vision and mission. The budget is outlined properly and broken down into identifiable items.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provided a plan for implementation and a defined time horizon. Also there has been provision of metrices that can be used to measure the success of this proposal. if the proposal is successfully implemented it provides a useful solution to the problem at hand. The only thing is not making provision for future problems and how they might be dealt with and also whether there might be the need for future funding.
